title: The Last Visit
key_events: Lena breaks promise and visits Adrian in quarantine
Adrian can only access theoretical/ghost emotions, not real ones
Lena reveals she's seeing someone new (Daniel)
Adrian responds with mathematical detachment, feels nothing
Lena recognizes Adrian as already gone, like her father
Final goodbye - Lena says love made data matter
Adrian recognizes he should be devastated but feels only mathematics

character_development.Adrian: Ghost of emotions remaining, trying to feel but mostly failing, recognizing horror of not feeling horror
character_development.Lena: Moving on with Daniel, giving final goodbye, comparing Adrian to her father near end

planted_elements: Lena moving on establishes her life apart from Adrian
The parallel to her father complete - empty eyes, scripted responses
Question of whether transformation is death with extra steps
Lena's future choice when thin place arrives
transformation_stage: Stage 1 late/Stage 2 beginning - emotional responses theoretical only, empathy as mathematical modeling, ghost feelings fading
cosmic_horror_elements: The horror of recognizing you can't feel horror
Love remembered as fact but not as feeling
themes: Love as what makes data matter
Death by degrees vs sudden loss
The impossibility of saying goodbye when one person is already gone
